Package project

Class Collection

java.lang.Object
project.Collection
public class Collection
extends java.lang.Object
The Collection class is what stores albums and handles features. The Collection class's features include: add new albums, remove albums, lend out albums, return albums, and print albums in the collection. The Collection class's print functionality includes: print albums in the collection, print albums in the collection sorted by Date, and print albums in the collection sorted by Genre.
Author:
Manav Bali, Daniel Lopez

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean add​(Album album)
    Checks the current collection size and adds the album to the albums[] array.
    private int find​(Album album)
    Looks through the albums[] array to see if the album is in the collection.
    private void grow()
    Increases the albums[] array by 4 without losing any albums.
    boolean lendingOut​(Album album)
    If album is available then lending out completes and it becomes not available.
    void print()
    Checks if collection is empty and if not calls prints the entire albums[] array.
    void printByGenre()
    Sorts albums[] by Genre and prints them.
    void printByReleaseDate()
    Sorts albums[] by release date and prints them.
    boolean remove​(Album album)
    Checks if the album is in the collection.
    boolean returnAlbum​(Album album)
    Checks if the album is in the collection and if it is available.

    • albums

      private int numAlbums

  • Constructor Details

    • Collection

      public Collection()

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Album album)
      Looks through the albums[] array to see if the album is in the collection.
      Parameters:
      album - that is being searched for.
      Returns:
      index if found, -1 is not in collection.

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the albums[] array by 4 without losing any albums.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Album album)
      Checks the current collection size and adds the album to the albums[] array. If the size is too small, the array size gets increased. If the size is 0 the array albums[] is initialized.
      Parameters:
      album - that needs to be added.
      Returns:
      true if album is added, false otherwise.

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Album album)
      Checks if the album is in the collection. Removes that album and moves albums after the removed back a spot in the array.
      Parameters:
      album - that is being removed.
      Returns:
      true if album is removed, false otherwise.

    • lendingOut

      public boolean lendingOut​(Album album)
      If album is available then lending out completes and it becomes not available. If album is not available lending out does not complete.
      Parameters:
      album - that is being lent out.
      Returns:
      true if album is lent out, false otherwise.

    • returnAlbum

      public boolean returnAlbum​(Album album)
      Checks if the album is in the collection and if it is available. If album is available then return does not complete . If album is not available return completes and it becomes available.
      Parameters:
      album - that is being returned.
      Returns:
      true if album has been returned, false otherwise.

    • print

      public void print()
      Checks if collection is empty and if not calls prints the entire albums[] array.

    • printByReleaseDate

      public void printByReleaseDate()
      Sorts albums[] by release date and prints them.

    • printByGenre

      public void printByGenre()
      Sorts albums[] by Genre and prints them.
